intro: Camissoniopsis luciae, commonly known as the Sierra lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as meadows and slopes. It has hairy, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Camissoniopsis luciae is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in late spring to early summer.
